titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Washington Metro Oral History Project collection, 1975-2021 MS2214
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-02-23 15:41:36 -0500.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Washington Metro Oral History Project collection
did.abstract: This collection consists of oral history interviews conducted by Dr. Zachary Schrag. These oral histories relate to the history of the Washington Metro.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Example: Peter Craig, interview by Zachary M. Schrag, Washington D.C., 5 November 1999, Washington Metro Oral History Project, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: The following oral histories are sealed until the earlier of narrator's death or January 1, 2050: Francois, Francis; Bowie, Md.; February 25, 2002; Kulash, Damien; Washington, D.C.; June 20, 2001. The following oral history is sealed until January 1, 2050: Herman, William; telephone; March 20, 2000. The following oral history is sealed until January 3, 2050: Thresher, Sprague; telephone; January 3, 2000

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Zachary M. Schrag retains copyright to these materials and licenses them to researchers under the Creative Commons Atribution 3.0 Unported license, http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode (19 April 2007). Except as specificied in the access restriction regarding sealed interviews, researchers may copy, transmit, distribute, or adapt the interviews (in recorded or printed form) provided that they include attribution to the Washingto Metro Oral History Project as well as to the interviewer and narrator.

bioghist.head: Historical or Biographical Note
bioghist.p: This collection is composed of oral histories conducted by Dr. Zachary Schrag. Dr. Schrag is a history professor at George Mason University in Fairfax County, Virginia. Dr. Schrag conducted these interviews as research for his Ph.D dissertation. His dissertation was eventually published in 2006 as the book The Great Society Subway: A history of the Washington Metro.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection is composed of compact discs and several transcripts of oral histories. Dr. Zachary Schrag conducted these oral histories with people involved in the design, development, and construction of the Metro in Washington, D.C. Dr. Schrag interviewed many people significantly involved with the creation of the Metro including local politicians Gilbert Gude and Walter Fauntroy; the first Secretary of Transportation Alan Boyd, engineer Howard Lyon; architect John Insco Williams; Commission of Fine Arts member John Carl Warnecke; and lawyer and transportation activist Peter Craig.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: Interview recordings and Interview transcripts and notes.

odd.head: Link for uploaded content
odd.p: The recordings and some transcripts of a portion of these oral histories are available in the Internet Archive. Internet Archive search

did.unittitle: Interview recordings and transcripts (at this time not all interviews have transcripts)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains oral history interviews conducted by Dr. Zachary Schrag. These interviews range in date from 1975-2002 and 2021.

odd.head: link for uploaded interviews
odd.p: The recording and when available the transcripts of these oral histories are available in the Internet Archive. Material from this collection can be found at https://archive.org/details/gwulibraries?sort=titleSorter&&and[]=subject%3A%22MS2214%22

odd.head: General
odd.p: Barbara Richardson in 2021 was Executive Vice President, External Relations, Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority
At the time of the map redesign discussed in the interview, Richardson was the Assistant General Manager of Customer Service, Communications and Marketing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains transcripts of oral history interviews conducted by Zachary Schrag. It also includes notes taken by Zachary Schrag during these interviews.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Please note that when a transcript of a recording is in digital form it is linked from the recording folder in series 1.

odd.head: Link for uploaded interviews
odd.p: There are transcripts for a small portion of these oral histories. These are available in the Internet Archive. Material from this collection can be found at https://archive.org/details/gwulibraries?sort=titleSorter&&and[]=subject%3A%22MS2214%22

odd.head: General note
odd.p: This transcript includes corrections made by Mr. Owen in April 2002

odd.head: General note
odd.p: This folder includes notes taken by Zachary Schrag on his recorded interviews with various participants in the history of the Washington Metro. Excluded are those interviews for which verbatim transcripts exist.

odd.p: This folder includes notes taken by Zachary Schrag on his recorded interviews with various participants in the history of the Washington Metro. Excluded are those interviews for which verbatim transcripts exist.
